lead_paragraph: A look at Molenbeek and other parts of Brussels suggests that immigrants from North Africa, particularly Morocco, are angrier and more alienated than the city’s Turks.

headline.print_headline: A Close Look at Brussels Offers a More Nuanced View of Radicalization
headline.main: A Close Look at Brussels Offers a More Nuanced View of Radicalization

snippet: A look at Molenbeek and other parts of Brussels suggests that immigrants from North Africa, particularly Morocco, are angrier and more alienated than the city’s Turks.
abstract: Memo From Brussels; close looks at Molenbeek neighborhood of Brussels, where many involved in Paris and Brussels terrorist attacks were based, offers nuanced view of radicalization; most attackers came from North African and Moroccan communities that are divided within themselves and hostile to authority; none of attackers were from city's large community of Turks, despite fact that group has also experienced discrimination aimed at Muslims.
